channel.title: May 20th 2012
channel.description:
Lets figure out a deadline for the game to go online, no alpha, no beta, all bugs fixed etc etc.
Looking at github we have some work to do, lets put things in priority.
1. Attack an npc bug (mass exp) should be fixed 2.. list 3.. list Last..Xml
We should also have a weekend (possibly this weekend) where we can meet in #moparclassic and get shit done. I know github provides this ability as each person can submit a request but it would be nice to communicate and tackle issues together (such as the npc glitch)

item.title: May 20th 2012
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:3, topic:437661”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=540365.msg3957828#msg3957828 date=1332948781]
Since the server automatically updates when a change is pushed to github, it would be best if all the known bugs were fixed one at a time until such a point where we can say there are no known bugs and just remove the ‘beta’ title.
[/quote]
you mind sharing how you implemented the auto updating?[/quote]
Jenkins builds the project on push to github, then I wrote a script that does something like this:

use gnu screen to stop LS and GS
rsync over new code
use sed to plug in server-specific details in the configuration files
use gnu screen to start LS and GS

I can post the scripts if it interests anyone.

Read full topic
